name: PyRate
tagline: PyRate is a Python program to estimate speciation, extinction, and preservation rates from fossil occurrence data using a Bayesian framework.
body:
The methods implemented in PyRate are described here:

Silvestro, D., Schnitzler, J., Liow, L.H., Antonelli, A. & Salamin, N. (2014) _Bayesian Estimation of Speciation and Extinction from Incomplete Fossil Occurrence Data_. Systematic Biology, 63, 349–367.

Silvestro, D., Salamin, N., Schnitzler, J. (2014) _PyRate: A new program to estimate speciation and extinction rates from incomplete fossil record_. Methods in Ecology and Evolution, 5, 1126–1131

A detailed manual can be found [here](https://github.com/dsilvestro/PyRate/wiki).
Please report suggestions and bugs to this [email address](mailto:pyrate.help@gmail.com).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
